016package edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.controller;
017
018import android.os.Bundle;
019import android.view.LayoutInflater;
020import android.view.Menu;
021import android.view.MenuInflater;
022import android.view.MenuItem;
023import android.view.View;
024import android.view.ViewGroup;
025import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
026import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
027import androidx.core.view.MenuProvider;
028import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
029import androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity;
030import androidx.lifecycle.Lifecycle.State;
031import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
032import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
033import androidx.navigation.Navigation;
034import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
035import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.R;
036import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.databinding.FragmentEcosystemBinding;
037import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.viewmodel.EcosystemViewModel;
038
039/**
040 * Presents a user interface comprising menu items in the action bar (and the overflow menu), as
041 * well as a display of the terrain of the ecosystem simulation (implemented by
042 * {@link edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.view.TerrainView}) and additional key measures of the simulation.
043 */
044@AndroidEntryPoint
045public class EcosystemFragment extends Fragment implements MenuProvider {
046
047  private FragmentEcosystemBinding binding;
048  private EcosystemViewModel viewModel;
049  private boolean running = false;
050  private boolean absorbed = true;
051
052  @Nullable
053  @Override
054  public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable ViewGroup container,
055      @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
056    super.onCreateView(inflater, container, savedInstanceState);
057    binding = FragmentEcosystemBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false);
058    return binding.getRoot();
059  }
060
061  @Override
062  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
063    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
064    LifecycleOwner owner = getViewLifecycleOwner();
065    FragmentActivity activity = requireActivity();
066    activity.addMenuProvider(this, owner, State.RESUMED);
067    setupViewModel(owner, activity);
068  }
069
070  @Override
071  public void onDestroyView() {
072    binding = null;
073    super.onDestroyView();
074  }
075
076  @Override
077  public void onCreateMenu(@NonNull Menu menu, @NonNull MenuInflater menuInflater) {
078    menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.ecosystem_options, menu);
079  }
080
081  @Override
082  public void onPrepareMenu(@NonNull Menu menu) {
083    MenuProvider.super.onPrepareMenu(menu);
084    menu.findItem(R.id.pause).setVisible(running && !absorbed);
085    menu.findItem(R.id.run).setVisible(!running && !absorbed);
086  }
087
088  @Override
089  public boolean onMenuItemSelected(@NonNull MenuItem menuItem) {
090    boolean handled = true;
091    int itemId = menuItem.getItemId();
092    if (itemId == R.id.run) {
093      viewModel.run();
094    } else if (itemId == R.id.pause) {
095      viewModel.pause();
096    } else if (itemId == R.id.restart) {
097      viewModel.create();
098    } else if (itemId == R.id.settings) {
099      Navigation.findNavController(binding.getRoot())
100          .navigate(EcosystemFragmentDirections.navigateToSettings());
101    } else {
102      handled = false;
103    }
104    return handled;
105  }
106
107  private void setupViewModel(LifecycleOwner owner, FragmentActivity activity) {
108    viewModel = new ViewModelProvider(requireActivity()).get(EcosystemViewModel.class);
109    getLifecycle().addObserver(viewModel);
110    // When we observe that a new terrain is created, pass it to the TerrainView.
111    viewModel
112        .getTerrain()
113        .observe(owner, (terrain) -> {
114          binding.terrain.setTerrain(terrain);
115          binding.terrain.invalidate();
116        });
117    // Any observed ecosystem updates indicate that the terrain content has changed; force redraw.
118    viewModel
119        .getEcosystem()
120        .observe(owner, (ignored) -> binding.terrain.invalidate());
121    // When the ecosystem moves into or out of the absorbed/absorbing state, the simulation has
122    // either stopped (moved into the absorbing state) or restarted (new ecosystem, not in the
123    // absorbing state); in either case, the menu mut be refreshed.
124    viewModel
125        .getAbsorbed()
126        .observe(owner, (absorbed) -> {
127          this.absorbed = absorbed;
128          activity.invalidateMenu();
129        });
130    // When we observe the model starts running or is paused, the menu must be refreshed.
131    viewModel
132        .getRunning()
133        .observe(owner, (running) -> {
134          this.running = running;
135          activity.invalidateMenu();
136        });
137    // When a new ecosystem is created, the LiveData<Integer> containing the number of breeds is
138    // updated; this information must be passed to the TerrainView, so that it can build an array of
139    // Paint instances (each with a different color), with a length equal to the number of breeds.
140    viewModel
141        .getInitialBreedCount()
142        .observe(owner, (numBreeds) -> {
143          binding.terrain.setNumBreeds(numBreeds);
144          binding.terrain.invalidate();
145        });
146
147    // TODO Using the same viewModel as is used in the operations above, get a reference to the
148    //  LiveData<Long> containing the iteration count of the ecosystem simulation (see the
149    //  getIterationCount() method in EcosystemViewModel); observe that LiveData, and pass the value
150    //  received by the observer to the corresponding text widgets in the fragment_ecosystem layout,
151    //  to display the iteration count.
152
153    // TODO Using the same viewModel as is used in the operations above, get a reference to the
154    //  LiveData<Integer> containing the number of extant (surviving) breeds in the ecosystem
155    //  simulation (see the getCurrentBreedCount() method in EcosystemViewModel); observe that
156    //  LiveData, and pass the value received by the observer to the corresponding text widgets in
157    //  the fragment_ecosystem layout, to display the breed count.
158
159    // TODO Using the same viewModel as is used in the operations above, get a reference to the
160    //  LiveData<int[]> containing the current population sizes of all of the breeds in the
161    //  ecosystem (see the getPopulations() method in EcosystemViewModel); observe that LiveData,
162    //  and pass the value received by the observer (after any necessary conversion from int[] to
163    //  one or more Strings) to the corresponding text widgets in the fragment_ecosystem layout, to
164    //  display the population counts.
165  }
166
167}
